# retagging(with:)

**Instance Method**

Changes the color space tag of the bitmap image representation.

## Declaration

```swift
func retagging(with newSpace: NSColorSpace) -> NSBitmapImageRep?
```

## Parameters

- **newSpace**: The desired color space.

## Return Value

An [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBitmapImageRep], or `nil`, if the conversion fails. If the original [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBitmapImageRep] already uses that color space, it is returned as is.

## Discussion

This method will definitely fail if you pass a color space that has a different color space model than the receiver. That is, if your original image is sRGB, you can only retag with some other RGB colorspace.

## Managing Color Spaces

- **converting(to:renderingIntent:)**: Converts the bitmap image representation to the specified color space.
- **colorSpace**: The color space of the bitmap.
